issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I'm unable to successfully install my prepopulated sqlite database on any android device.
The DB file has over 15.5 mb - it is a dictionary and it has such size for it's contents, which will be doubled in near future.

every time I try to install this DB with Titanium API I get this error.

Even if the app is created only of app.js and file.sqlite and in the app js is nothing more than 

{code:lang=javascript} 
Ti.API.info('about to install db');
var db = Titanium.Database.install('newWorld.sqlite', 'newWorld');
Ti.API.info('db is = '+db);
{code} 

it crashes with this log in console.

{code}

But it does not happen if the Database is like 120kb of size, is there any way to get this fixed anytime soon ? 
Or at least install bigger files to SDcard and open that file ? 

Edit1: sorry for the typo in code it was really .install() but as I've posted this really late yesterday (or today dunno what time it was) I've simply misspelled the word.
fields.summary: Android: Unable to install pre-populated DB from Android resources
fields.environment:
* Titanium SDK version: 1.7.2 (06/24/11 15:26 57d536e...)
* Titanium studio up-to-date
* android sdk 2.2 QVGA emulator + device

comments.body:
Note that there is an error in your code - you have used an {{instal}} rather than {{install}} method.

Please would you post the Titanium SDK build date and hash, shown in the console before the app launches?

To determine whether {{install()}} or {{open()}} is failing, would you run only {{Ti.Database.install('file.sqlite','database')}} and then browse the device using {{ddms / Device / File Explorer}} to determine whether the db file has been copied to {{data/data/your_device_id/}} or one of its subdirectories (ie the databases dir)?

Cheers

Hi, sorry for misspelling the word, as it is said in Edit, it was really late.
{code}
[INFO] Titanium SDK version: 1.7.1 (06/21/11 14:28 1293a6d)
{code}
I've tried only the install method and I've got something new in my console output.
So here is the corresponding app.js code 
{code}
...
if(db == null)
{
		Ti.API.info(Titanium.Platform.osname);

	if(Titanium.Platform.osname == 'android')
	{
				
		Ti.API.info("android install");
		
		//var f = Ti.Filesystem.getFile(Titanium.Filesystem.externalStorageDirectory,'/databases/newWorld.sqlite');Ti.API.info(f.nativePath);
		var f = Ti.Filesystem.getFile('file:///data/data/' + Ti.App.id + 'databases/', 'newWorld');Ti.API.info(f.nativePath);
		
		if(f.exists() == true)
		{
			Ti.API.info('file exists in database dir');
		    db = Titanium.Database.open(f);
		}
		else
		{
		    Ti.API.error('file does not exist at all ');
		    db = Titanium.Database.install('newWorld.sqlite', 'newWorld.sqlite');
		}

				
	}
	else
	{
		
		db = Titanium.Database.install('newWorld.sqlite', 'newWorld');
	}
	
	Ti.API.info('db is = '+db);
}
...
{code}
and here is the console output
{code}
